      • isConnected

        @Nonnull
 @CheckReturnValue
public CompletionStage<Boolean> isConnected(@Nonnegative
                                                                        int id)
        Description copied from interface: ShardManager
        Checks whether or not the shard with the given ID is currently connected to the websocket gateway. This is done as a boolean because - at least for now - there's only 2 meaningful states: connected, and queued to be connected.

        If the shard id does not exist (ex. not controlled by this shard manager instance), then the future will FAIL, and this case must also be handled.

        This is fetched asynchronously.

        Specified by:
        isConnected in interface ShardManager
        Parameters:
        id - The id of the shard to get connection status for.
        Returns:
        Whether or not the shard with the given id is currently connected to the websocket gateway.

      • shardState

        @Nonnull
 @CheckReturnValue
public CompletionStage<LifecycleState> shardState(@Nonnegative
                                                                              int id)
        Description copied from interface: ShardManager
        Get the lifecycle state for the current shard. This provides more meaningful info than ShardManager.isConnected(int), because it provides more granular info about the shard's state. However, it does not differentiate between "connected" or not per se; it is up to the end-user to determine whether or not the lifecycle state is actually a state of being "connected."

        If the shard id does not exist (ex. not controlled by this shard manager instance), then the future will FAIL, and this case must also be handled.

        This is fetched asynchronously.

        Specified by:
        shardState in interface ShardManager
        Parameters:
        id - The id of the shard to get the lifecycle state for.
        Returns:
        The lifecycle state for the shard with the given id.
